channel.title: Spleef Areana!
channel.description:
I got bored of redstone and had nothing to do. I started just putting a circle in the air and was originally going to do a tower. Then I remember a fun minigame, 'spleefing'. I decided to make a fun little spleefing areana. I finished up to the design in the video. Reyx7 helped me with a problem on the skirting, and Badger41 helped me with a few asthetic peices (around the roof, all of the obsidian, and a bit with the windows). This areana already has about 4-5 hours worth of play time, and Badger (for now) remains the Champion. Can you beat him 3 out of 5? Go check it out in W3 (Creative world).
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l_LKR0jsXWg [img]http://i.imgur.com/1d4emh.jpg[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/j16PKh.jpg[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/O1tk3h.jpg[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/TgLTfh.jpg[/img]

item.title: Spleef Areana!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:21, topic:436088”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=538811.msg3944362#msg3944362 date=1331703411]

[quote author=zuppers link=topic=538811.msg3944333#msg3944333 date=1331697906]

Cobble would be to slow for a successful spleefing game.

It’s in creative, so it occurs instantly. That’d actually be a cool idea.

people can fly in creative…
[/quote]They can change their gamemode.

Read what that conversation. Your post is seriously just making you look a bit dumb lol.
[/quote]Sometimes I only read the last reply because quotes drive me crazy. Also your post makes you look a bit dumb.[/quote]
I’m not trying to be rude but by doing that you missed an important piece of the conversation. I already addressed why creative mode is a problem in spleefing. As well as why cobblestone is bad for spleefing.

Read full topic

item.title: Spleef Areana!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:16, topic:436088”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=538811.msg3944197#msg3944197 date=1331689499]
Cobble would be to slow for a successful spleefing game.
[/quote]
It’s in creative, so it occurs instantly. That’d actually be a cool idea.[/quote]
In theory it would be nice yes, but now would be the issue of breaking through the borders of the area by accident. What happens when someone gets lazy and doesn’t repair? As well as people can fly in creative. It just causes many issues that are not worth trying.

Read full topic

item.title: Spleef Areana!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What if you use something that can be generated instead? I guess cobblestone might be too slow to mine for this competition though…

Read full topic

item.title: Spleef Areana!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Its entirely possible to automate the process, but with the current areana no. I’ll make a concept later of an area to “press a button” and it will rebuild itself. The issue is, it will use print-heads that will need to be refilled every so often. There is only one way to do that.

So all in all I think its easier to just use the replace by hand method.

Read full topic

item.title: Spleef Areana!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You could do it using sand to push from the sides, but you couldn’t do it more than once, and you’d be limited by the amount pistons can push (I think 12?)

EDIT - Did a small scale test, and it works.

You could have it filled in with snow, destroy it with one game, then hit the button X times (in this case 4 I believe) and it all comes back. I’m sure there are ways to make it reload pretty fast too, but this was just a proof of concept

Obviously you’d hide the sand and such

RplYp.jpg1408×1654

Read full topic

item.title: Spleef Areana!
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:436088”][quote author=hat trix link=topic=538811.msg3943189#msg3943189 date=1331594309]
nice arena, me and manbearpig built one about a month ago on world 2. being that its not creative though, i added a half-assed snowball looter lol. rebuilding it can be a pain
[/quote]

In a non-creative world, I wonder if rebuilding the floor could be automated using pistons, that would be neat. :)[/quote]
Would be incredibly challenging and had to stuff together based off of the size of the arena. Even if it wasn’t hidden it would be nearly impossible to get the blocks to the center and get the pistons away.

Read full topic
